definition.name: NXxrd_pan
definition.doc: NXxrd_pan is a specialization of NXxrd with extra properties for the PANalytical XRD data format.

field.name: data_file
field.doc: Name of the data file.

field.name: measurement_type
field.doc: Type of measurement.

field.name: definition
field.doc: Official NeXus NXDL schema to which this file conforms.

field.name: method
field.doc: Method used to collect the data default='X-Ray Diffraction (XRD)'

field.name: xray_tube_material
field.doc: Type of the X-ray tube.

field.name: xray_tube_current
field.doc: Current of the X-ray tube.

field.name: xray_tube_voltage
field.doc: Voltage of the X-ray tube.

field.name: k_alpha_one
field.doc: Wavelength of the K\u03b1 1 line.

field.name: k_alpha_two
field.doc: Wavelength of the K\u03b1 2 line.

field.name: ratio_k_alphatwo_k_alphaone
field.doc: K\u03b1 2/K\u03b1 1 intensity ratio.

field.name: kbeta
field.doc: Wavelength of the K\u00df line.

field.name: source_peak_wavelength
field.doc: Wavelength of the X-ray source. Used to convert from 2-theta to Q.

field.name: scan_axis
field.doc: Axis scanned.

field.name: scan_mode
field.doc: Mode of scan.

field.name: integration_time
field.doc: Integration time per channel.

group.name: experiment_config
group.doc: Collect user inputs e.g. name or path of the input file.

field.name: start
field.doc: Starting value of the diffraction angle.

field.name: end
field.doc: Ending value of the diffraction angle.

field.name: step
field.doc: Minimum step size in-between two diffraction angles.

field.name: start
field.doc: Starting value of the incident angle.

field.name: end
field.doc: Ending value of the incident angle.

field.name: step
field.doc: Minimum step size in the between two incident angles.

field.name: beam_attenuation_factors
field.doc: Beam attenuation factors over the path.

field.name: goniometer_x
field.doc: Goniometer position X.

field.name: goniometer_y
field.doc: Goniometer position Y.

field.name: goniometer_z
field.doc: Goniometer position Z

field.name: count_time
field.doc: Total time of count.

group.name: experiment_result
group.doc: All experiment results data such as scattering angle (2theta), intensity, incident angle, scattering vector, etc will be stored here.

field.name: intensity
field.doc: Number of scattered electrons per unit time.

field.name: two_theta
field.doc: Two-theta (scattering angle) of the diffractogram.

field.name: omega
field.doc: Incident angle of the diffractogram.

field.name: phi
field.doc: The phi range of the diffractogram.

field.name: chi
field.doc: The chi range of the diffractogram

field.name: q_parallel
field.doc: The scattering vector component, which is parallel to the sample surface.

field.name: q_perpendicular
field.doc: The scattering vector component, which is perpendicular to the sample surface.

field.name: q_norm
field.doc: The norm value of the scattering vector, q. The scattering vector is defined as a difference between the incident and scattered wave vectors. For details: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Powder_diffraction and https://theory.labster.com/scattering-vector/

group.name: q_data
group.doc: The desired view for scattering vectors.

field.name: q
field.doc: This concept corresponds to the norm value of the scattering vector(q). The concept is the same as 'q_norm' of 'experiment_result' and should be linked to /entry[ENTRY]/experiment_result/q_norm.

field.name: intensity
field.doc: Number of scattered electrons per unit time at each scattering vector (q) value. The concept is the same as the 'intensity' of experiment_result and should be linked to /entry[ENTRY]/experiment_result/intensity.

field.name: q_parallel
field.doc:
The scattering vector (q) component, which is parallel to the sample surface. This component is used in the Reciprocal Space Mapping (RSM) technique of X-ray diffraction method.
The concept is the same as 'q_parallel' of experiment_result, and should be linked to /entry[ENTRY]/experiment_result/q_parallel.

field.name: q_perpendicular
field.doc:
The scattering vector component, which is perpendicular to the sample surface.
The concept is the same as 'q_perpendicular' of experiment_result, and should be linked to /entry[ENTRY]/experiment_result/q_perpendicular.

field.name: sample_mode
field.doc: Mode of sample.

field.name: sample_id
field.doc: Id of sample.

field.name: sample_name
field.doc: Usually in xrd sample are being analyzed, but sample might be identified by assumed name or given name.
